sentences.en: But the old sheds and bankers were distasteful to him.
sentences.cn: 但是那儿那些旧日的工作棚和工作台,都让他看着很讨厌了.

sentences.en: Don't force her into a distasteful marriage.
sentences.cn: 不能强迫她与她不喜欢的男人成婚.

sentences.en: Even the thought of her was distasteful to him.
sentences.cn: 他即使一想起她来,都感到恶心.

sentences.en: He found it distasteful to be offered drinks before witnessing the execution.
sentences.cn: 他觉得在目睹行刑前还要上酒让人很不舒服。

sentences.en: I find his attitude highly distasteful.
sentences.cn: 我觉得他的态度很令人厌恶.

sentences.en: I found it a touch distasteful.
sentences.cn: 我觉得这略有点让人反感。
这事简直太叫人不开心了.

sentences.en: Some of us find this distasteful - an undignified kind of life.
sentences.cn: 我们一些人对此十分厌恶,认为这是一种极不光彩的生活.

sentences.en: Such surreptitious bypassing of Standlely was distasteful.
sentences.cn: 这种偷偷摸摸的绕过斯坦德莱的做法令人厌恶.

sentences.en: The fiddler's crude and irreverent sense of humor was distasteful to him.
sentences.cn: 拉琴人的粗鲁无礼的幽默感使他讨厌.

sentences.en: The medicine is distasteful but good for you.
The suggestion was distasteful to Gatsby.
sentences.cn: 这个建议不合盖茨比的口胃.

sentences.en: The way Charles tried to make up to the boss was distasteful to the workers.
sentences.cn: 工人们很看不惯查尔斯想巴结老板的那种样子.

sentences.en: The work was thoroughly distasteful to her.
What follows is John’s story. Parts of it may seem distasteful, even shocking.
sentences.cn: 接下来是约翰的叙述，其中有些部分也许令人不快，甚至令人震惊。

words.tran_cn: 令人不快的；不合口味的；表示厌恶的

trans.tran_cn: 使人不愉快的，讨厌的，不合口味的，表示厌恶的
